policy.content:
Privacy Policy for zd小达's Websites

zd小达's Websites (collectively referred to as the “Websites”) run on xiaoda.fun, bilibili.party and other related domains and subdomains, as well as PWA apps based on these domains. This privacy policy describes how the Websites use and protect any information you provide to us. We are committed to ensuring that your privacy is protected. If you provide personal information to the Websites, you can be confident that it will only be used in accordance with this privacy statement.

Our privacy policy was last updated on November 22, 2025.

Website Visitors

Like most website operators, the Websites collect non-personally identifying information such as browser type, language preference, referring site, and the date and time of each visitor request. The Websites’ purpose in collecting non-personally identifying information is to better understand how visitors use the Websites. From time to time, the Websites may release non-personally identifying information in the aggregate, for example, by publishing a report on trends in the usage of the Websites.

Collecting Personally-Identifying Information

Certain visitors to the Websites choose to interact with the Websites in ways that require the Websites to gather personally-identifying information. The amount and type of information that the Websites gather depends on the nature of the interaction. For example, we ask visitors who comment on our blog to provide a username and email address.

Information Protection

We take reasonable measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access or use. We delete your personal information when it is no longer needed and keep it only for as long as necessary.

Please note that the personal information you provide will be stored within mainland China. We take appropriate measures to protect your personal information and comply with relevant Chinese laws and regulations.

Use of Personal Information

We will not sell or rent your personal information to third parties unless we have your consent or are legally required to do so.

We will send you emails when your comments receive replies or pass moderation. If you have agreed to receive messages, you may opt out later.

You have the right to stop us from contacting you at any time. If you no longer wish to receive such emails, please click the unsubscribe link at the bottom of the email.

Your Rights Regarding Your Information

Under data protection laws, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information that we hold. In particular, you may have the right to:

  • Request a copy of the personal information we hold about you.
  • Request that we update the personal information we hold about you, or correct personal information that you believe is incorrect or incomplete.
  • Request that we delete the personal information we hold about you from live systems, or restrict how we use such personal information (for deleting information from archives, see the “Retention of Personal Information” section).
  • Object to our processing of your personal information.
  • Withdraw your consent to our processing of your personal information (to the extent that such processing is based on your consent and consent is the only basis for processing).

Third-Party Links

The Websites may contain links to other websites provided by third parties that are not under our control. When you click a link and provide information to a third-party site, please be aware that we are not responsible for the data provided to that third party. This privacy policy applies only to the websites listed at the beginning of this document, so when you visit other websites—even if you click a link posted on the Websites—you should read their respective privacy policies.

Third-Party Services

We also use services provided by Tencent Cloud, Cloudflare, Huawei Cloud, and Google Analytics to give our visitors a better experience. These services may collect information about your use of our websites. For details about these services, please refer to the following links:

  • Tencent Cloud Privacy Policy
  • Cloudflare Privacy Policy
  • Huawei Cloud Privacy Policy
  • Google Privacy Policy

Cookies

We also use “cookies” to automatically collect information about how you use our website. Cookies are small text files placed on your computer to collect standard Internet log information and visitor behavior information. This information is used to track visitors’ use of the website and compile statistical reports on website activity.

For details on which cookies the Websites collect, please read our Cookie Policy.

Privacy Policy Changes

Although most changes are likely to be minor, the Websites may change their privacy policy from time to time at the sole discretion of the Websites. The Websites encourage visitors to frequently check this page for any changes to its privacy policy. Your continued use of this site after any change in this privacy policy will constitute your acceptance of such change.

Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns about this privacy statement, please contact us at:

Email: xiaoda@duck.com

cookies.title: Cookie Policy | zd小达's Websites
cookies.content:
Cookie Policy for zd小达's Websites

Our Cookie Policy was last updated on November 22, 2025.

What are Cookies?

Cookies are small pieces of data stored in text files that are placed on your computer or other devices when websites load in a browser. They are widely used to “remember” you and your preferences, either for a single visit (through a “session cookie”) or for multiple repeat visits (using a “persistent cookie”). They ensure a consistent and efficient experience for visitors and perform essential functions such as allowing users to register and stay logged in. Cookies may be set by the site that you are visiting (known as “first-party cookies”), or by third parties, such as those who serve content or provide advertising or analytics services on the website (known as “third-party cookies”).

Why We Use Cookies

We use cookies to improve your experience, including but not limited to:

  • Remembering your login status so you stay signed in across pages.
  • Storing your language preference so the Websites can serve you better.
  • Tracking and analyzing Website traffic with Google Analytics.

How You Can Control Cookies

Most browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can choose to disable cookies as needed. Please note that disabling cookies may affect your experience and cause some features to not function properly. For more information on how to control cookies, please visit the help page of your browser.

Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns about this cookie statement, please contact us at:

Email: xiaoda@duck.com
